version_description:
New: Sharing individual sites
New: watchOS 2 compatible

NEW TO LASTPASS? Download LastPass now and get the protection you need completely for free. New users can choose to have free access from: iPhones, iPads, Personal computers.

CURRENT USERS: GET MORE WITH LASTPASS PREMIUM
- Unlimited sync across unlimited devices (desktops, smartphones and tablets)
- Share a folder of logins & notes with others, with a Shared Family Folder
- Premium multifactor authentication options for more security
- Priority tech support

New: Sharing individual sites
New: watchOS 2 compatible

NEW TO LASTPASS? Download LastPass now and get the protection you need completely for free. New users can choose to have free access from: iPhones, iPads, Personal computers.

CURRENT USERS: GET MORE WITH LASTPASS PREMIUM
- Unlimited sync across unlimited devices (desktops, smartphones and tablets)
- Share a folder of logins & notes with others, with a Shared Family Folder
- Premium multifactor authentication options for more security
- Priority tech support

Fixed: Non-English localizations will now show in iOS 9.
Fixed: Copy and show password menu will appear when rows are selected on view screen.
Fixed: Drown-down lists will show when selected on web pages.

Fixed: Localizations on iOS 6.
Fixed: Error when accepting shared items.

Fixed bug in lock screen.
Fixed performance issues in watchOS app.
Fixed crash in the Safari extension.

New: Big website icons in your vault make it easier to find your logins at a glance and keep your passwords organized. We love the new look and feel and hope you will, too!

New: Plan ahead with Emergency Access. Give trusted family or friends a way to access your vault in case of an emergency. For added security, you can require a waiting period between when your Emergency Access contact(s) can request access to your vault, and when access is granted, so you can decline the request if needed. Once access is granted, your vault appears as a folder in their vault. If your trusted contact doesn’t have a LastPass account, we’ll help you invite them so they can manage your passwords on your behalf if ever needed.

Fixed: Links that should open in new tabs now do so.
Fixed: "Frame load interrupted" error.
Fixed: Blank screen that could occur when launching from the notification center.

New

• LastPass has a new icon and logo! We took the best of our new design with LastPass 4.0 — fresh, bold, simple, colorful, modern, and user-friendly — along with the modern image of logging in, and crafted our new logo and icon. You'll soon be seeing our new logo and icon across our entire service. Head to our blog at blog.lastpass.com for more details!
• Form Fill support in the LastPass Safari extension. Now you can use the profiles you've stored in LastPass for easy form-filling as you browse in Safari. 
• Generate passwords in the LastPass Safari extension. When you're signing up for a new website and need to create a new account, you can open the "add site" view from the Safari extension and use the password generator to instantly create a long, strong password for your new login.

Fixed

• We resolved an issue where 6-digit PIN codes weren't being recognized, and now give you the choice between 4- and 6-digit PIN codes for even more security.

• LastPass has a new icon and logo! We took the best of our new design with LastPass 4.0 — fresh, bold, simple, colorful, modern, and user-friendly — along with the modern image of logging in, and crafted our new logo and icon. You'll soon be seeing our new logo and icon across our entire service. Head to our blog at blog.lastpass.com for more details!
• Form Fill support in the LastPass Safari extension. Now you can use the profiles you've stored in LastPass for easy form-filling as you browse in Safari. 
• Generate passwords in the LastPass Safari extension. When you're signing up for a new website and need to create a new account, you can open the "add site" view from the Safari extension and use the password generator to instantly create a long, strong password for your new login.

• We resolved an issue where 6-digit PIN codes weren't being recognized, and now give you the choice between 4- and 6-digit PIN codes for even more security.
• Fixed a crash that occurs on iOS 6.
Fixed bug that would show the URL of frames within the page rather than the main page and prevent autofill from working.

This release fixes a bug that can cause poor performance in the Safari extension.

Thanks everyone for your feedback!

This release fixes a bug that can cause poor performance in the Safari extension, and fixes a crash that can occur in the previous version.

Thanks everyone for your feedback!

This release fixes an issue with the in-app PIN screen.

Thanks everyone for your feedback!

version_name: 4.1:**LastPass is now FREE on iOS!**We heard you loud and clear. You can install LastPass on your iPhone

version_description:
This release includes support for upcoming LastPass features, and a couple minor bug fixes.

Thanks everyone for your feedback!

tl;dr: LastPass is free across devices, the UI is simplified, and we're iOS 10 compatible.

Version 4.1:
**LastPass is now FREE on iOS!**
We heard you loud and clear. You can install LastPass on your iPhone, iPad, Mac, and any other devices you own completely free.

**Browser Extension**
Did you know you can autofill usernames and passwords from your vault in Safari or Chrome on your device? (Probably not, and that's our fault.) We've added a new walkthrough in Tools to help you get that set up. It just takes a couple taps to set up, and then you'll be signing in at ludicrous speed.

**Simpler Interface**
We've moved popular features out of the hidden sidebar menu and put them in tabs along the bottom. The Tools page is always one tap away at the bottom of the screen. Settings have been cleaned up including the removal of the "Hide usernames in vault" option. We also added a Refresh Vault button in Settings > Actions.

**Odds & Ends**
We're fully compatible with iOS 10 and the latest iPhone hardware, including 3D touch from the home screen and the vault.


Thank you for your continued support of LastPass. If you like the app, please leave us a review in iTunes or tell a friend! Remember, it's free!
Fixes a browser crash.

4.1.2 squashes some bugs:
• Favorites no longer persist on top of search results.
• If you turn on Touch ID, we actually prompt you for your fingerprint.
• New pages in the browser don't always force a new tab to open.
• Improved a few things that misbehaved when you rotate your screen.

4.1:
• LastPass is now FREE on iOS! Get your passwords on your iPhone, iPad, and Mac with a free LastPass account.
• Made it easier to add our extension Safari or Chrome from the Tools page so you don't have to switch back and forth across apps.
• Simplified interface that does away with the hidden sidebar menu.

We appreciate your continued support of LastPass. If you like the app, please rate us on iTunes.

v4.1.3 includes small changes focused on improving your LastPass experience. Specifically:
• Progress indicators show up when you share or unshare items in your Vault.
• Fixed an issue where the keyboard wouldn't dismiss after typing your master password.
• Updated lock options so that if you turn on Touch ID or PIN code security, the Vault locks immediately when the app is backgrounded.
• Modernized the interface for adding and viewing attachments to Secure Notes.
• Fixed a crash that was affecting some users when launching the LastPass Extension.
• Fixed an issue that prevented users from falling back to the Master Password if Touch ID was not accepted.
and more!

v4.1:
• LastPass is now free on mobile! Access your Vault on your devices completely free.
• Updated our interface to feel more familiar and consistent with your favorite iOS apps.
• Introduced the new Tools page with quick access to useful features like the LastPass Extension and Password Generator.

We've implemented a few bug fixes and improvements based on your feedback with v4.1.4. Specifically:
• Resolved an issue that was causing some users to have to type their master password after authenticating with Touch ID.
• Improved visibility of the Copy Password shortcut button on vault entries. (You knew about the Copy Password shortcut, right?)
• Other under-the-hood improvements were made that contribute to the overall stability of the app. 

Your support is important to us and we do read all your feedback. If you enjoy using LastPass, please rate our app in the iTunes Store.

v4.1.5 brings swipe gestures back to your LastPass vault. 
• Swipe from the right to view vault items.
• Swipe from the left to share or manage sharing for vault items.
• There's still the Copy Password shortcut on every site. Users of newer iPhones can also use 3D Touch to peek items and copy username/password.

Additionally:
• We fixed a bug that was causing the app to crash on load for some users. 
• We cleaned up the experience for vault items that require reprompt and eliminated the "ghost keyboard" some users were reporting.

Your support is important to us and we do read all your feedback. If you enjoy using LastPass, please rate our app in the iTunes Store.

New year, new us! Our resolution in 2017 is to continue making LastPass the best way to simplify your digital life. This version includes several important fixes to issues reported by our users: 
• Improved handling of Auto Logout settings when you restart your device. So if you have Touch ID enabled, after a device reboot you can just use your fingerprint to get back into LastPass.
• Fixed a bug that was allowing the vault contents to appear ever-so-briefly before the red cover screen displayed
• Introduced diagnostic logging for users: Settings > Help and Support > Enable Diagnostic Logging. Including this kind of information with support requests helps us help you.
• Fixed a bug that wasn’t persisting grid/list view choice on iPad. 

Your support is important to us and we do read all your feedback. If you enjoy using LastPass, please rate our app in the iTunes Store.
This version squashes a bug that was causing a blank screen on iPads for some users. Thanks to everyone who reported this issue!

We’ve been working hard to improve the LastPass app on iOS! This release includes the following changes:
- Performance improvements when loading the vault and secure note attachments.
- Added multi-word search capability in the vault.
- Apple Watch search improvements, as well as several bug fixes.
- Fixed an issue where shared folders and linked personal accounts disappear from the vault.
- Fixed some error messages and corrected a few typos.
- Several other minor updates.

Keep the feedback coming! You can contact us through the Settings page in the app, by selecting Help and Support.

We’ve been working hard to improve the LastPass app on iOS! This release includes several small improvements and bug fixes, including:
- Updated PIN code page.
- New 3D Touch shortcuts.
- Fixed multifactor trust setting not working.
- Fixed saving phone number in form fills.

Keep the feedback coming! You can contact us through the Settings page in the app, by selecting Help and Support.

We’ve been working hard to improve the LastPass app on iOS! We are pleased to announce that this release includes support for Yubikey! You can now use your Yubikey NEO for second factor authentication, on iPhone 7 and later with iOS 11+. In addition, we have refreshed the user interface for all of our second factor options, and fixed a couple of bugs.

We're excited to announce that LastPass now supports in-app password filling with iOS 12! Now, when you open an app on your iPhone  or iPad the  keyboard itself will offer your username or password as an autofill option. This same functionality also allows you to autofill in mobile sites in Safari with fewer taps.

Let LastPass store and fill all your passwords securely across mobile sites and apps.

New to this release: Now you can recover your account on your phone. If you ever get locked out of your LastPass account, you can reset your Master Password through Touch ID or Face ID authentication. Your phone is now your safety net, so you never have to worry about losing access to LastPass.

Keep the feedback coming! You can contact us through the Settings page in the app, by selecting Help and Support.

New to this release: We’ve improved the localization of the LastPass app in Brazilian-Portuguese, Dutch, French, German, Italian, Japanese, and Spanish. For new users whose device is set to a language we support, the app will now automatically apply that language. For most existing LastPass users running the app in English, we’ll show a pop-up with the option to select your preferred language.
 
Keep the feedback coming! You can contact us through the Settings page in the app, by selecting Help and Support.

Keep the feedback coming! You can contact us through the Settings page in the app, by selecting Help and Support.

Starting with the login screen, you'll notice we've taken the first steps toward freshening our look. It's part of our continuing effort to make sure LastPass is easy to use, fresh, and as reliable as ever.
Keep the feedback coming! You can contact us through the Settings page in the app, by selecting Help and Support.

Added the option to use our brand new, enterprise-level LastPass MFA app when logging in into your LastPass account. For more information about the new MFA offering, visit LastPass.com.
 
We also fixed an annoying bug causing unexpected logouts from the app for some users.

Dark Mode is now available in the LastPass app! This release features a refreshed light theme and all-new dark theme.

If you have Dark Mode enabled on your iPhone, you will automatically see the LastPass app in Dark Mode the next time you login.

How do I set my device to Dark Mode?
Go to your device Settings -> Display & Brightness -> Dark

How do I manually enable Dark Mode in the LastPass app without changing my device settings?
Within LastPass, go to Settings -> Advanced -> Theme -> Make a selection

Additional details:
Our dark mode appearance is only available on iOS 13.

What’s new: Bug fixes and improvements that make LastPass easier to use and ensure secure access to your passwords, from anywhere.
Some highlights include:
- Shared folders are now accessible via the mobile vault for linked business and personal accounts.
- Enabled business users to verify their linked personal accounts in the mobile app.
- Fixed Apple Watch crash to streamline vault access.
